data.description:
====== IMPORTANT ======
THE COMPANION APP FOR iOS IS CURRENTLY PENDING APPROVAL, AND IS EXPECTED TO RELEASE AROUND MAY 14TH.

THE COMPANION APP IS REQUIRED FOR POSTING MESSAGES.
====== IMPORTANT ======

The PebbleSOS Companion App will allow you to inform your friends on Facebook when you're in danger!

1. Log in to your Facebook Account through the main page of this app, and grant access to publish actions and statues

2. When facing with dangerous situations, whether it's kidnapping or robbery, just shake your Pebble Watch really hard. A five-seconds countdown will start on your watch 
	1) You may cancel the countdown by clicking any button on your watch
	2) If you don't cancel the countdown, a status will automatically be posted to your Facebook, calling for "Help!" with your current location attached, this will be visible to all your friends.

i.e. if your current location is London, England, the status will be 
   "Help needed!! My location: 51.509979, -0.133700 #PleaseHelp #PebbleSOS" with longititude and latitude indicating your exact location.

   Once your friends see that status, your help should be on the way!

IMPORTANT:
Please do not abuse this application, the intention of this app is to save a friend or yourself when in serious danger or emergency situations.

latest_release.release_notes: Initial public release.

data.description:
FitCat features both a virtual pet and an activity tracker in a single watchapp. 

Watch Gnocchi, your cat, live his own life on your wrist. What he does depends on what YOU do: if you are walking, he will be walking too. If you are chilling, he will be chilling too.
The more you move, the more virtual money you earn. Then you can use that money to interact with Gnocchi and make him happy.

FitCat is the funniest way to live an active life.

Features:
-	Different animations of the cat
-	Many environments with day and night variations
-	Integrated mini game
-	Fully compatible with Pebble Health
-	You can set your daily step goal and see your achievements
-	Timeline pins to inform you about your daily step goal

If you like FitCat, give it a heart ! <3

There is still a lot more to come ... 
To stay tuned, follow me on Twitter : @PaulKubGames

changelog.release_notes: Fixed Google authentication issue. Now you will need to use passcode, thanks to Google's policy change.

Quick fix a crash of 1.9. Previous version changes:

Optimized memory usage: gracefully handle most Out-of-Memory (OOM) conditions; decreased AppMessage buffer size. Should now work way better and stop crashing, especially on Aplite platform. Sometimes you will see <OOM> labels here and there; this means that you either have many tasklists or have many tasks / tasks with large notes in current list. Note that Time series watch have more memory available and will seldom suffer of this issue.

Optimized memory usage:
gracefully handle most Out-of-Memory (OOM) conditions;
decreased AppMessage buffer size.
Should now work way better and stop crashing, especially on Aplite platform.

Sometimes you will see <OOM> labels here and there; this means that you either have many tasklists or have many tasks / tasks with large notes in current list.
Note that Time series watch have more memory available and will seldom suffer of this issue.

Added option to change location of "Add task" command.
Added option to use larger fonts for tasks list.
Fixed statusbar display bug introduced in previous version.
Fixed bug causing big tasklists (over 100 tasks) to fail to load.

Added basic support for Pebble Round. Visuals may be not neat, but it should be useable.
Also added a "strike out" effect on colour Pebble watches (like the one which was used on b&w Pebbles).

Implemented new task adding with Dictation API which was added in 3.6 firmware.
Also fixed timezone glitch for Timeline pins.

1. Finally fixed bugs related to configuration saving/loading. Now all sorting options should work fine, even after app restart.

2. Implemented very basic timeline support. When you open certain tasklist, all tasks in it which have due date set will be added to your timeline. Note that if you add/change/delete due dates of your tasks, timeline pins will only be updated after you open corresponding tasklist in watch app. I hope to fix it later.

Implemented sorting tasks by due date.
There might be some bugs related to sorting, please feel free to report.
Fixed memory allocation bug which sometimes caused app to silently crash on 3.2 firmware
Fixed «black selected text on black selection» bug on PebbleTime

Should now work on Pebble Time.
Now done tasks are displayed in details in green color.

Implemented task sorting (by status, by date, alphabetic) - configured from phone.
Improved overall stability.
Fixed bug with some tasklists being not shown when there are many tasklists.
Fixed several minor bugs.
New in this version: show task details (including notes) on long Select press

data.description:
Browse all your ToDo lists (from GoogleTasks) right on your wrist! Task notes are supported too. You can also mark tasks as Done. You will no longer need to look at your phone while buying groceries in store or something else. This app uses task lists stored in Google Tasks service. You can manage them from the web browser on your PC or phone. Also you can use any GoogleTasks-compatible mobile ToDo/notes app.
Voice input is now supported as well! You can add tasks by dictation.
Previous names: PebbleNotes, PebbleTasks.

changelog.release_notes:
The main update is the ability to automatically register a username on the Hue Bridge (before it had to be done manually):

- On app installation the configuration page will be opened on the phone (and a message to edit the configuration displayed on the Pebble).

* Increase and decrease brightness using the top and bottom buttons.

data.description:
Pebble app to facilitate quick control of a Philips Hue light bulb.

It will toggle the preselected light ON or OFF as soon as the app loads, so it is designed to be registered as a button shortcut for quick light control. When the app is already open the Up and down will also change the brightness of the light.

Automatic pairing with the bridge has been added.

Any questions or bugs can be reported in the "source link" below.

data.description:
Check bus or transit time everyday? You'll love this app! CatchOneBus will show nearby transit stops and live arrival times. You can save any stop as favorite and CatchOneBus will show your favorite stop's live arrival time immediately when you are near that stop and open the app. You can shake your Pebble to update the information in real time.

Currently works in the following list of cities and areas and supported by the public transit API provided by various organizations and agencies.
• Seattle, Tacoma, Bellevue, Everett, WA  (OneBusAway)
• Portland, Beaverton, Gresham, Hillsboro, OR (TriMet)
• Boston, Cambridge, Medford, MA (MBTA)
• New York metropolitan area, NY (MTA)
• Tampa Area, FL (HART)
• Vancouver, BC (Translink)

Using Tips:
• Make sure to turn on location services on your Pebble Time app on the phone.
• Save a bus stop as favorite for easy access, especially for your daily used stops for commute.
• Set quick launch on your pebble watch for CatchOneBus to achieve checking commuter bus real time with one click.

App developed by Yaoyu Yang and Dian Zhang. Give us a like or feedback!

latest_release.release_notes: Add bus route number in subtitle.

data.description:
Store your current weight, height and body fat measurements on your Pebble watch.

- Connect your Google Fit / Fitbit accounts to sync your statistics through the Watchapp settings section of the Pebble phone app
- Use your statistics to calculate your daily calorie intake (currently using the Katch-Mcardle formula)
- Set a weekly measurement remind via an app wake up

Connected account notes:

Google Fit - currently only your weight and height can be synced through Google Fit

Fitbit - your weight and body fat can be synced through your Fitbit account, your height will only be sent to Fitbit as there is no date stored against the height in the account. Fitbit will only return data for up to 31 days so if you haven't updated in that period the app will not be able to download that data.

Update May 2017 - unfortunately, due to the way in which the authentication screen to connect your Google account to the app is presented through the Pebble app, Google has prevented access to this page so new connections cannot currently be made.

Update July 2017 - The Google authorization process is now working again but has had to change for the above reasons, which now require some extra setup steps. See the app Settings page for instructions on how to do this

data.description:
CalorieTimer turns Calorie counting upside-down! Instead of counting the number of Calories you consume in a day, the CalorieTimer counts down the amount of time until you can next eat based on any Calories you input.

You simply press the UP button for each 100 Calories you consume, and this adds a given amount of time to the timer, which counts down to zero letting you know when you have used up those calories.

The magic is that it does not matter if you reach zero every single day, or if you only reach zero once in a month or ONCE A YEAR!, it is the exact same number of calories consumed up to that point, giving you the same results!

Now counts NEGATIVE calorie debt to track your overall deficit! (optional and configurable).

*UPDATE* : 20-05-2015 : v1.15 - added negative calorie debt feature (configurable).

*UPDATE* : 03-05-2015 : v1.14 - added feature to allow configuration of calorie increment amount per button-press (100 calories is default).


Usage;

1. pressing UP or DOWN will add or subtract 100 calories from your timer.

2. pressing the MIDDLE button will allow you to configure the amount of target calories per day (default 1800).

3. strongly suggested that you add this as a quick-launch for ease of use.

data.description:
Meet the Ludus app – the fitness coach that builds, refines and guides you through personalized workouts.

With Ludus, you don't need a gym to break a sweat. Home or away, even if you’ve only got 10 minutes, you can complete your workout with no trouble at all. Burn calories and train your body with interactive video workouts – using nothing but your own bodyweight! Ludus helps you build up your endurance, gain strength and feel good all day long.

At the beginning of each session you'll see a preview of your exercises. When you strap your phone around your arm, Ludus will start counting your repetitions. Improve your accuracy by connecting your Pebble Watch to the app. It’ll tell you when you hit the right posture, showing your avatar following your moves live on your Apple TV screen.

In order to plan your next workout, Ludus will ask you to rate how you feel after each exercise. It’s designed to evolve with you and your goals!
After each session, you’ll see a summary of how you did. You can comment and share your progress – along with any badges you've earned – with your friends. Ludus will keep track of your training journal so you can focus on your workouts.

Ludus is here to help you kick off your fitness journey. It’s about more than just exercising – it's about improving every day. Start now!

data.description:
Unofficial watch app for monitoring and operating Chamberlain/Liftmaster branded MyQ devices over the Internet (Requires MyQ Internet Gateway, usually sold separately) , now including the "MyQ Garage" device, which connects to 3rd party garage doors. 

Currently supports garage door openers AND light switches - other types of devices may be added soon.

- Uses SSL to communicate securely with the official MyQ servers
- Does NOT require a companion app on your phone
- DOES require your Pebble to be connected to your phone and your phone to have a data connection (bear in mind that you may be on the edge of your home wifi just outside your garage)
- Username and password is stored on your phone and are only ever sent to the official MyQ servers. Password is also encrypted on your phone

- Up/Down switches devices
- Select changes the status of the device

- To save Pebble battery it does not constantly monitor the device status except when opening/closing a garage door. To update the status, switch devices with the Up/Down button (even if you only have one device) or reopen the app
- Closes automatically after 2 minutes of inactivity to help avoid accidentally operating a device
- Assign it to a Quick Launch button in your Pebble settings for easy access

latest_release.release_notes: Fix for light switches with the latest MyQ API (hopefully)

data.title: HomeP - For MyQ Garage Doors & Light Switches

data.description:
Challenge yourself to be more fit with the Deck of Cards Workout. Assign an exercise to each of the four suits and then do the number shown on each card, with face cards representing 10 (or higher if you prefer a stronger challenge). After each set of eight cards, you'll be prompted to alternate exercises, at which point you can also insert additional exercises as you see fit.  As the cards are random, each workout is slightly different.

Example workout:
------------------------
Spades: Push-ups
Clubs: Leg Lifts
Diamonds: Burpees
Hearts: Squats

Interval Exercise: 200 yd. Dash.

(Optional) Even-numbered sets:
Spades: Crunches
Clubs: Planks (10 seconds x number on card)
Diamonds: Standing Lunges
Hearts: Ab Twists

data.description:
This app will give you tactile feedback for the time elapsed so that you can know the time just from the vibration. For Ex: You want to meditate for 20 minutes. You start the app by pressing the quick launch button. The following is the pattern of vibrations.
Starts with 5 short vibrations.
Vibrates 2 times for even minutes, 2, 4, 6, 8...
On the 9th minute, vibrates 10 times.
On the 19th minute vibrates 20 times.
On the 29th minute vibrates 30 times.
Continues up to 60 minutes.
So you will know the time just from the vibration count.
Press Top button to Pause
Press bottom button to Resume.

data.description:
A game of gesture based mimicry and dexterity

The players stand in a circle and one player starts with the watch in his hand. That player moves the watch in one fluid motion. To signify that the action has been recorded, the watch will vibrate and the MimeStone puts on his game face. The watch is then passed on to the next player. This player has to do the action performed by the player before him, and then add his own action. Performing the right moves makes the MimeStone happy, but getting a move wrong will make him cry and that player will be eliminated. Each successive player does all of the actions of the players before him/her, and then adds their own. When a player is eliminated the list of moves resets, and the other players continue as if they started a new game. The last player remaining is the winner !

A Pokédex-App including all 801 Pokémon from all generations plus Mega Evolutions and Alola Forms.

- English and German name (configurable), types, number and generation of every Pokémon.

- Up (hold): step 1 (25) Pokémon backward
- Down (hold): step 1 (25) Pokémon forward
- Press Select: toggle language/Mega Evolution/Alola Form
- Hold Select: random Pokémon
- Press Select on "Pokémon 000" to change order

This app is based on the Pokédex by shutdown27 and the Pokédex by DKote with friendly permissions.
